Thanks and Regards

ChG

entry.title: To set up a destination in SAP BTP for connecting to the Microsoft Azure Mail Service -Graph API
entry.content:
1. Access SAP BTP Cockpit 

  • Log into SAP BTP Cockpit: Go to SAP BTP Cockpit 
  • Navigate to Subaccount: In the subaccount of your choice (where the destination will be configured), click on the subaccount to access its settings.

2. Create a New Destination

  • Navigate to Destinations:

    • In the SAP BTP Cockpit, go to Connectivity > Destinations (under the Connectivity section in your subaccount).

    • Create New Destination:

      • Click + (Create New Destination).

      • Fill in the following fields:

3. Configure the Destination for Microsoft Graph API

     Fill in the required fields to define the destination for Microsoft Graph API:

     General Information

  • Name: Choose a descriptive name for the destination, e.g., AzureMailService.

  • Type: Select HTTP.

  • Description: Provide a brief description, e.g., "Destination for Microsoft Graph API to send transactional emails."

  • URL:  https://graph.microsoft.com/V1.0

4. Authentication Settings

  • Authentication:

    • Select OAuth2 for OAuth authentication, since Microsoft Graph API requires OAuth2 Client Credentials flow.

    • OAuth2 Client Credentials: This will be your method for obtaining access tokens to authenticate API requests.

      • OAuth2 Client ID: This is the Client ID from the Azure AD app you registered in the Azure portal.

      • OAuth2 Client Secret: This is the Client Secret generated for the Azure AD app.

      • OAuth2 Token URL: The token URL from Microsoft Identity Platform, which is:

         
        https://login.microsoftonline.com/{tenantId}/oauth2/v2.0/token

        Replace {tenantId} with your actual tenant ID.

      • OAuth2 Scope: For sending emails, use the scope Mail.Send. This allows the app to send emails through Microsoft Graph API.

      • OAuth2 Grant Type: Choose Client Credentials as you're using the client credentials flow.

5.Connection Settings

  • URL: Set the URL to connect to Microsoft Graph API. The base URL for Microsoft Graph is:

     
    https://graph.microsoft.com

  • Proxy Type: If you are using a proxy, you can set it here. If not, leave it as None.

  • Additional Headers: You can add any extra headers if needed. Usually, for Microsoft Graph API, no additional headers are required apart from the authorization header, which is handled automatically by the OAuth2 configuration.

6. Test the Destination

  • Test Connectivity: After creating the destination, test it by clicking on Check Connection.

  • Successful Connection: If the connection is successful, youâll see a message confirming that the destination is reachable.

7. Secure the Destination

  • Security Considerations:

    • Make sure that only authorized users and applications have access to this destination.

    • You can use Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) to limit who can access this destination in SAP BTP.

8. Integrate the Destination into Your Application

Once the destination is configured, you can integrate it into your Node.js or CAPM application to use it for sending emails.

  • Access Destination Programmatically:

    const { retrieveJwt } = require('@sap-cloud-sdk/connectivity');
    const { executeHttpRequest } = require('@sap-cloud-sdk/http-client');
    module.exports = srv => {
      srv.on('sendmail', async (req) => {
            const JWT_Token = retrieveJwt(req);    // Access the destination via JWT Secured token
        const destination = {
          destinationName: 'AzureMailService', JWT_Token
         };
      }
    }

Use Destination in API Requests: Use the executeHttpRequest method from the SAP Cloud SDK to make requests to the Microsoft Graph API, passing in the destination to authenticate the request.

Conclusion

By setting up a destination for the Microsoft Azure Mail Service in SAP BTP, you establish a secure and centralized way for your SAP applications to send transactional emails via the Microsoft Graph API. This eliminates the need for third-party email services, reduces costs, and ensures a reliable and scalable email service across your BTP landscape.

entry.title: SAP Fiori Rap - Dynamic value help based on another table field via CDS/Annotations?
entry.content:
Hi all - I have created a Fiori RAP application based on a DB table where user can create/delete/update table entries. I am working on creating input helps for certain table fields. 

Is it possible to dynamically create a value help field based on the value of another table field via pure RAP CDS/annotations? For example, In column A, the search help for the field will present two options (VKORG and ZTEST). In column B, depending on what was selected in Column A, will determine the search help values. If user adds an entry for VKORG, then in column B the search help will be composed of different sales orgs. If user selects ZTEST, then the search help in column B will contain other options pertaining to ZTEST. 

Column AColumn B 
VKORG0001
ZTEST0123

 


__PRESENT

entry.title: System downtime message from SM02 on Fiori launchpad
entry.content:
When the system experiences downtime for a specific period, it is important to notify users promptly. In SAP GUI, system-wide announcements or maintenance notifications are broadcast using transaction code SM02. However, the Fiori Launchpad, built for a modern user experience, does not automatically display SM02 messages as popups or notifications.

To address this gap, the following blog explains how to create a custom plugin that enables downtime messages to be displayed on the Fiori Launchpad.

 

You should start by creating a new BAS project using the standard project generators for a freestyle application. To do this follow the next steps:

  1. Launch BAS. Once loaded, go to File >> New Project from Template.

 

2. Select SAP Fiori Application generator and click on Start

 

3. Select SAPUI5 freestyle from application type dropdown, followed by selecting the SAPUI5 Application generator and clicking on Next.

 

4. If you want to show hardcoded data on Popup then Select Data source = None and click on Next.

 

5. Otherwise, If you want to show message via any backend service or message present in  SM02 transaction then Select 

Data source = Connect to System

System = <Give Your system name>

Service <Select desired service url>

and click on Next.

 

 

 

6. Use default value for field View name and click on Next.

7. Enter the following details and click on Finish:

Parameter

Value

Module Name:

< Your plugin module name > (for example: zflp.systdowntime.plugin)

Application Title:

< Your plugin title > (for example: System downtime message Plugin on Launchpad)

Application Namespace:

< Your plugin namespace > (for example: com.plugin)

Description:

< Your plugin description > (for example: SAP Fiori Launchpad Plugin)

Project folder path:

< Your project root folder in BAS > (for example: /home/user/projects)

Minimum SAPUI5 version:

< Your backend system SAPUI5 library version > (for example: 1.84.14)

Add deployment Configuration:

No

Add FLP configuration

No

Configure advanced options

No

8. In our case, we need to create an SAP Fiori Launchpad plugin. Since controllers, views, and routers are not required for this plugin, we should delete the corresponding folders and their contents. To do this, right-click the folder and select Delete Permanently from the context menu.

 

9. With all files and folder deleted, your project should only contain the i18n folder, component.js and manifest.json files.

 

NOTE - As we have modified the project structure and deleted test files, you will not be able to test the plugin from BAS, you would need to deploy the plugin to the on-premise system for testing. Plugin deployment is explained in the following sections.

10. Open the manifest.json file in your project and take note of the value of the ID parameter. 

 

 

11. Do the below changes into Manifest file.

 

12. Sample Manifest code:

{

  "_version": "1.28.0",

  "sap.app": {

    "id": "com.plugin.zflp.systdowntime.plugin",

    "type": "component",

    "i18n": "i18n/i18n.properties",

    "applicationVersion": {

      "version": "0.0.1"

    },

    "title": "{{appTitle}}",

    "description": "{{appDescription}}",

    "resources": "resources.json",

    "sourceTemplate": {

      "id": "@sap/generator-fiori:basic",

      "version": "1.18.4",

      "toolsId": "d7c0a4d1-7ec4-4765-a65f-ef409eb221aa"

    },

    "dataSources": {

      "mainService": {

        "uri": "/sap/opu/odata/iwbep/Backend_Messages/",

        "type": "OData",

        "settings": {

          "annotations": [],

          "localUri": "localService/mainService/metadata.xml",

          "odataVersion": "2.0"

        }

      }

    }

  },

    "sap.flp": {

      "type": "plugin"

    },

  "sap.ui": {

    "technology": "UI5",

    "icons": {

      "icon": "",

      "favIcon": "",

      "phone": "",

      "phone@2": "",

      "tablet": "",

      "tablet@2": ""

    },

    "deviceTypes": {

      "desktop": true,

      "tablet": true,

      "phone": true

    }

  },

  "sap.ui5": {

    "flexEnabled": true,

    "dependencies": {

      "minUI5Version": "1.84.14",

      "libs": {

        "sap.m": {},

        "sap.ui.core": {}

      }

    },

    "contentDensities": {

      "compact": true,

      "cozy": true

    },

    "models": {

      "i18n": {

        "type": "sap.ui.model.resource.ResourceModel",

        "settings": {

          "bundleName": "com.plugin.zflp.systdowntime.plugin.i18n.i18n"

        }

      },

      "": {

        "dataSource": "mainService",

        "preload": true,

        "settings": {}

      }

    },

    "resources": {

      "css": [

        {

          "uri": "css/style.css"

        }

      ]

    },

    "routing": {

      "config": {

        "routerClass": "sap.m.routing.Router",

        "viewType": "XML",

        "async": true,

        "viewPath": "com.plugin.zflp.systdowntime.plugin.view",

        "controlAggregation": "pages",

        "controlId": "app",

        "clearControlAggregation": false

      },

      "routes": [

        {

          "name": "RouteView1",

          "pattern": ":?query:",

          "target": [

            "TargetView1"

          ]

        }

      ],

      "targets": {

        "TargetView1": {

          "viewType": "XML",

          "transition": "slide",

          "clearControlAggregation": false,

          "viewId": "View1",

          "viewName": "View1"

        }

      }

    },

    "rootView": {

      "viewName": "com.plugin.zflp.systdowntime.plugin.view.App",

      "type": "XML",

      "async": true,

      "id": "App"

    }

  }

}

NOTE - Plugins do not require additional definitions, this would be the simplest version of a manifest.json file and the base for creating an FLP plugin.

13.  Copy below sample code into your Component.js file code.

 

 

 

Sample Component code :

sap.ui.define([
"sap/ui/core/UIComponent",
"sap/ui/Device",
"sap/m/MessageBox"
], function (UIComponent, Device, MessageBox) {
"use strict";

return UIComponent.extend("com.plugin.zflp.sysdowntime.plugin.Component", {
metadata: {
manifest: "json"
},

/**
* The component is initialized by UI5 automatically during the startup of the app and calls the init method once.
* @Public
* @override
*/
init: function () {
// call the base component's init function
UIComponent.prototype.init.apply(this, arguments);
var that = this;
var rendererPromise = this._getRenderer();

rendererPromise.then(function (oRenderer) {
var oModel = that.getModel();
oModel.read("/downtimeMessageSets", {
success: function (oData) {
MessageBox.warning("Testing Message - System Downtime.");
console.log("Got Warning");
}
});
});
},

_getRenderer: function () {
const that = this;
const oDeferred = new jQuery.Deferred();
let oShellContainer;
that._oShellContainer = jQuery.sap.getObject("sap.ushell.Container");

if (!that._oShellContainer) {
oDeferred.reject("Illegal state: shell container not available; " +
"this component must be executed in a unified shell runtime context.");
} else {
oRenderer = that._oShellContainer.getRenderer();
if (oRenderer) {
oDeferred.resolve(oRenderer);
} else {
// renderer not initialized yet, listen to rendererCreated event
that._oShellContainer.attachRendererCreatedEvent(function (oEvent) {
oRenderer = oEvent.getParameter("renderer");
if (oRenderer) {
oDeferred.resolve(oRenderer);
} else {
oDeferred.reject("Illegal state: shell renderer not available after receiving 'rendererCreated' event.");
}
});
that._oShellContainer.attachRendererCreatedEvent(that._onRendererCreated);
}
}

return oDeferred.promise();
}
});
});

Deploy your Plugin to your SAP S/4HANA backend system.

14.  Once you have adjusted the code you would need to deploy your code to On prem system.

15.  Right-click on your project name (for example: zflp.systdowntime.plugin) and from the menu, select option Open in         Integrated Terminal.

16.  From the terminal, run command npm run deploy-config

  • Select Target : ABAP
  • Select your backend destination and press Enter.
  • Define a name for the ICF node that will be created on deployment (for example: ZFLPLUGINPOPUP) and press Enter.
  • Enter a description to your ICF node (for example: Plugin for setting FLP Title) and press Enter.
  • Enter the name of the plugin package you created earlier (for example: ZFIORI_PLUGIN) and press Enter.
  • Enter a transport request (manually, choose from existing or create a new transport request)

17.  Wait for the process to conclude.

 

18.  From the terminal, run command npm run deploy, review your deployment setting and enter YES to continue (press Enter). Wait for the process to conclude.

 

19.  Go to SICF Tcode and note down the Url .

 

20.  Now we must activate your SAP Fiori Launchpad Plugin created above. To do that login to your system in GUI or WebGUI through FLP and run transaction: /N/UI2/FLP_CONF_DEF.

21.  Accept all dialog messages, double-click on section Define Launchpad Plug-ins followed by clicking on button New Entries. Enter the following details and Save (you will be prompted for a transport request):

 

22.  Run transaction: /N/UI2/FLP_SYS_CONF

23.  Accept all dialog messages, double-click on section âLaunchpad Plug-insâ section followed by clicking on button New Entries

24.  select your recently created plugin configuration (In step number 21)  and then click on Save.

25.  Once you activate your plugin it will automatically appear on your launchpad. In my case I am showing Message box. Once Launchpad is loaded our popup message will appear there.

entry.title: FIORI Sales order creation Version vs. GUI VA01
entry.content:
Hello SCN,

unfortunately, I was not able to find the corresponding clue on this.

Why is the behavior in Sales Order Management â Version 2, or when navigating to "Create Sales Order" [not the VA01- GUI], so different?

When I start via F3893 â "New Sales Order," I noticed the following differences:

  • No pop-up for material substitution

  • No pop-up for âpartial confirmationâ or availability check

Did I click something wrong, or is this really the case?

Is there a list of the differences?

Thanks!

entry.title: BAS on premise deployment errors for recently created projects
entry.content:
Hi All, 

Strangely I am facing some deployment issues using BAS, which is not the case till few weeks before.

error abap-deploy-task ZZ_FIOR_POC An exception with the type /UI5/CX_APP_API_INVALID _INPUT was raised, but was not handled locally or declared in a RAISING clause.
error abap-deploy-task ZZ_FIOR_POC Path /sap.app/i18n is not adressing a simple type (string, number, boolean, null)  .

For the first deployment it is giving above errors but deployment is happening , but can't access the app from FLP.

second time onwards deployment is failing with same errors, any clues are much appreciated.

Thanks

entry.title: Smartfield with search help and external parameter
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I have a query about some development work. I created a smart field in an XML view. This smart field contains warehouse data. This information depends on the 'Plant' field.

When the search help is opened, the view receives the data from the plant field and filters the warehouse for this plant, which is fine so far.

However, when I select a warehouse code, for example 'AACC', the search help closes and the backend is called to verify the selected value. During this process, the front end does not send the plant value to the back end. Consequently, the system retrieves a lot of warehouses with the code 'AACC'. The system then returns an error message.

What can I do to solve the problem?

Thank you so much!

entry.title: TreeTable in sapui5 - Expand collapse option not showing for Data in table
entry.content:
Hi Team,

Controller

--

Controller Code

 

onGLItem: function () {

var Nodes = [

{

NodeID: 1,

HierarchyLevel: 0,

Description: "1",

ParentNodeID: null,

DrillState: "expanded"

},

{

NodeID: 2,

HierarchyLevel: 1,

Description: "1.1",

ParentNodeID: 1,

DrillState: "leaf"

}

]

let OModel = new sap.ui.model.json.JSONModel({nodes: Nodes});

this.getView().setModel(OModel,"oflatTreeData");

<TreeTable
id="treeTable"
selectionMode="Single"
enableColumnReordering="false"
rows="{
path : 'oflatTreeData>/',
parameters : {
countMode: 'Inline',
treeAnnotationProperties : {
hierarchyLevelFor : 'HierarchyLevel',
hierarchyNodeFor : 'NodeID',
hierarchyParentNodeFor : 'ParentNodeID',
hierarchyDrillStateFor : 'DrillState'
}
}
}">

------

I have binded the data and display data in tabular level, but its not showing arrow mark with expand/collapse..

Why its not working, please help me

I referred sapui5 demo kit - https://sapui5.hana.ondemand.com/#/entity/sap.ui.table.TreeTable/sample/sap.ui.table.sample.TreeTable.BasicODataTreeBinding

 

Thanks

Madhava

entry.title: Integrating Cluster TY Data (PCL1) with Infotype 3671 (A1 Notification) in a Custom Fiori App
entry.content:
We are planning to develop a custom Fiori application âA1 Notificationâ in the ESS area in Austria, allowing employees to create A1 applications directly in the Fiori UI (including Subtype E2 â Multi-country assignments).

When creating a new A1 application with Subtype E2, multiple countries need to be specified. These country details are not stored in Infotype 3671 but are instead saved in Cluster TY (PCL1). Our goal is to store both the infotype data and the country information (cluster data) consistently and make them visible in IT3671. After insert a new Entry using FuBa HR_CONTROL_INFTY_OPERATION, the country information is not recognized or displayed in the infotype. According to our research, there is no official function module or BAPI that allows the simultaneous processing of IT3671 and Cluster TY including the 'cluster_guid'.

Questions:

  1. Does SAP provide a recommended approach or an internal API/BAPI for the correct processing of this data combination (Infotype + Cluster TY) for Subtype E2?

  2. How can it be ensured that the country information stored in the cluster is correctly linked to and displayed in Infotype 3671?

  3. Does SAP perhaps provide an example of such an implementation (e.g., from the standard ESS/MSS) that could be used as a reference?

Thanks for your Support!

entry.title: A document containing all steps needed to complate a business process/ flow in fiori
entry.content: which fiori apps and in what order will i need for example to do AP or AR process or asset accounting.

entry.title: RAP - Managed with Unmanaged Save
entry.content:
I know RAP supports Managed with Unmanaged Save scenarios, but in our case we seem to need the opposite.

Our main table is the standard Equipment Master which has to be updated using BAPIs, and we need to create a log table Z_AUDIT to log any changes made to the standard Equipment. So the main entity is the standard I_Equipment, and the new associated z entity is ZI_Equipment_Audit. 

How would you model the RAP root entry view?

define root view entity ZI_Equipment_Audit as 
  select from I_Equipment as Equip
    composition [1..*] of ZI_Audit as _Audit

We need a Managed behaviour for the Audit entity and Unmanaged for the root I_Equipment, because BAPI's are needed to update the standard Equipment master tables. That is not supported by RAP.

What would you suggest in this case?

Thanks

entry.title: Getting 404 error while deploying migrated project from BAS (migrated from webIDE)
entry.content:
hi 

I am trying to migrate project from custom UI5 application from webIDE to BAS and trying to deploy into on-premise system.  Getting 404 error while deploying.

error abap-deploy-task ZXXX Folder webapp has children and can't be deleted

Did anyone faced similar issue?

 

Thanks

Shankar

entry.title: S/4HANA Public Cloud 2502: Custom tile for Custom UI5 application with parameters
entry.content:
Dear SAP experts,

I have an issue with the Fiori app Display Line Item Entry (F2218) , which does not accept the URL parameters "P_FromPostingDate" and "P_ToPostingDate".

In on-premise systems I was able to solve this by creating a new tile as a copy of the standard one and adding the required parameters.

The problem is that in S/4HANA Public Cloud there is no SAP Fiori Launchpad Designer, so I cannot create a new tile in this way.

I used the following reference to create a Custom Tile, but this only works for external applications and does not allow me to add new parameters.

Â¿How can I create a tile with parameters in S/4HANA Public Cloud 2502?

Thank you very much.

Best regards,

entry.title: Documentation for DDIC tables of the DRC module
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

We need to display the contents of our VAT return transactions in DRC and those without DRC (i.e. from the old content FI-GL-GL-F) in a single custom query. This means, for example, that the contents of Fiori F1515 âRun Statutory Reportsâ â as shown here â must be displayed

The tables from FI-GL-GL-F that are needed to display this are known (FOTTDCLNOT, FOTDECLSTA, etc.), but the only one from DRC appears to be SRF_REP_RUN_DATA. However, there is currently no documentation on how this table is linked to individual transactions. Does anyone have any experience with this and know how we could move forward?
Best regards, Martin

entry.title: Fiori bookmark storage in SAP
entry.content:
Hello

We face the issue that after the upgrade user get dumps when selecting Fiori bookmarks, as the stored values are not valid anymore.

Now we would like to check which bookmarks face this issue and what values are stored.

Anybody knows in which tables the Fiori bookmarks are stored?

Thanks for your help

JD
